comment.author: 30937372@N00
comment._content: The caption to this could be correct. It's not State House Lusaka. The road layout is all wrong. If it is Penhalonga then this should belong in the Zimbabwe section

comment.author: 59350149@N07
comment._content: I believe that this is Government House, probably when newly constructed. Eventually the Barracks were opposite and the whole area was developed with housing, mainly government houses in an area known as Woodlands

comment.author: 59362370@N05
comment._content:
This is building stands on Independence Avenue in Lusaka, Zambia and used to be the Legislative Assembly during Colonial days in Northern Rhodesia. It lies behind the Cenotaph. It was later the National Assembly building before the Zambian Parliament was built. 
It is the old Secretariate.

comment.author: 59430401@N06
comment._content: Again, this is definitely the old Secretariate - not Government House/State House

comment.author: 74234541@N07
comment._content: Penhalonga is in the eastern highlands of Zimbabwe and surrounded by mountains! Sad about the archives getting it so wrong - what else is wrongly captioned?
